result.execSummary:
The defendant David William Myers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David William Myers

records.addlTxt: Partial bail refund

10:44 AM Defendant David William Myers appears via telephone. Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for David William Myers. Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties indicate that an agreement has been reached. Attorney Rosenthal indicates defendant will plead to sole count. 7 months jail, concurrent to MN case with 34 days sentence credit. State is in agreement.
Defendant pleads no contest to the sole count. Defendant waives right to be present in court and prefers to do this appearance by phone. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds that the defendant's plea has been feely, intelligently, and voluntarily made. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders 7 months jail, concurrent to MN case 69DU-CR-19-461. 34 days sentence credit. $200 fine plus costs. Bail will be applied. Any bail refund will be mailed to defendant in Lino Lakes Prison.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.

01:37 PM Defendant David William Myers in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant David William Myers in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David William Myers appeared by video means with Attorney.
Address confirmed as address on complaint; correct city is HERMANTOWN;   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. 
State request 1000.00 cash bail-no use or possession of drugs or paraphernalia; failures to appear; two extraditions warrants from 2018 and 2019; criminal history as stated on record
Atty Hoffman-could post 400.00; defendant states he has trial coming up in St Louis County
Court-concerned about non appearances; on probation and committed felonies; Court orders  1000.00 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of drugs or paraphernalia  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
